name: Modeling in Ecology and Evolution
description: Study of ecology and evolution uses models to explain biological phenomena including the maintenance of biodiversity, population growth, competition, eco-evolutionary dynamics, trait and molecular evolution, epidemiology, spatial ecology, and extinction. Students will learn to develop, assess and apply analytical, simulation and statistical models for analysis and data interpretation.
prerequisites: BIO220H1, EEB225H1, MAT136H1/MAT137Y1/MAT223H1, and at least one of EEB319H1/EEB321H1/EEB322H1/EEB323H1
